summary:
David is an old-school systems' engineer, enjoying the challenges of meshing the diverse disciplines of science and engineering.  He started into Lab Automation at Applied Biosystems, leading architecture for a new oligonucleotide manufacturing plant. He moved from California to Milan, to join a drug discovery CRO, Axxam SpA, to create compound storage and management systems for high-throughput screening. He then moved back to the US to coordinate organizations of scientists and engineers to build a fully-integrated platforms with applications across genetic screening with Counsyl, mass-production of CRISPR RNA with Synthego, and liquid biopsy with GRAIL - the most recent role helping detect cancer at population-scale.

He has a Master in Physics at Cambridge University in the UK, a Masters in Instrumentation Systems, and a PhD in Medical Physics, creating novel instrumentation to detect breast cancer, both from University College London.

General
•	20+ years’ experience in Process / Systems Engineering, creating solutions with components and teams from various disciplines (mechanical, electronic, software, biology, chemistry) – 15+ in Lab Automation
•	15+ years of technical leadership with 10+ years of management (departments of up to 30, including senior managers and individual contributors), in a variety of regulated environments (CLIA, ISO 13485, GMP)
•	20+ years facilitation for interpersonal-/soft-skills training; certified Myers-Briggs practitioner

Technical
•	Deep knowledge of automation (inc liquid handling) for biotech manufacturing or sample processing (NGS)
•	Experienced process engineer, streamlining workflows for maximum efficiency and capex utilisation
•	Driven numerous data management solutions for automated production lines (LIMS / MES)
•	Created full suites of characterisation studies (DoE), analytics, and validation studies for tech transfer 
•	Responsible for proposal and execution for $100m+ capital expenditures

currentPositions.description: Created, hired, and manage all local R&D staff including automation engineers, tech/design transfer process engineers, and assay implementation scientists, with an aim to bridge the roles between main R&D team (in the SF Bay Area) and the RTP operations teams (in North Carolina). The RTP R&D team organises and supports the execution of product and process transfer to RTP (including all new builds and V&V activities) as well as continuous improvement activities
currentPositions.title: Senior Director, R&D Systems

headline: Senior Director, R&D Systems at GRAIL, Inc. RTP

certifications.name: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming

message.text: and here we go (again, but in Europe)
The quiet (exhibit hall) before the storm (of #SLASEurope2024 attendees.) We can't wait for you to see the transformation!
